title.narrative: Implementation of the Sustainable Urban Transport Program Indonesia (SUTRI NAMA)

description.narrative: This project will help transform urban transport with capacity building and investment. A Sustainable Urban Transport Fund will co-fund transport demand management measures, such as ‘park and ride’ facilities and the building of sidewalks and bicycle networks. The project will provide technical assistance to local governments, including assistance for reviewing Transport Master Plans and approaching investment programmes and the private sector for co-financing. It will stimulate a shift in local transport planning towards sustainable transport measures. Co-benefits include less congestion and air pollution, improved accessibility to public transport, creation of new jobs, and reduced social inequality. The transport sector emitted 25% of all energy-related emissions in 2010. With the rapid population growth and strong urbanization trends, demand is projected to highly increase. The NAMA Support Project could reduce GHG emissions by 0.9 to 1.7 Mt CO2e per year in 2030.

participating-org.narrative: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety

mailing-address.narrative: IKI Secretariat, Zukunft - Umwelt - Gesellschaft (ZUG) gGmbH, Stresemannstraße 69 - 71, 10963 Berlin, Germany
